    • Method Detail

      • solve

        public double[] solve(IMatrix a,
                      int idx,
                      double d)
        Description copied from interface: IMatrixSolver
        Solves the system of linear equations A * s = d. In openLCA this is used to calculate the scaling factors of an inventory where the vector d has just a single entry.
        Specified by:
        solve in interface IMatrixSolver
        Parameters:
        a - the technology matrix A
        idx - the index of the entry in the demand vector.
        d - the demand value (the entry in the vector d).
        Returns:
        the calculated scaling vector s

      • multiply

        public double[] multiply(IMatrix m,
                         double[] v)
        Description copied from interface: IMatrixSolver
        Calculates a matrix-vector product. In openLCA we use this for example when we calculate the inventory result: g = B * s
        Specified by:
        multiply in interface IMatrixSolver

      • scaleColumns

        public void scaleColumns(IMatrix m,
                         double[] v)
        Description copied from interface: IMatrixSolver
        Scales the columns of matrix m with the factors in v. This is equivalent to m * diag(v) but can be implemented in a more efficient way.
        Specified by:
        scaleColumns in interface IMatrixSolver
